data.title: Where to watch: Streaming and broadcast guide to the 2024 U19 World Cup
data.meta_description: The tournament in South Africa will be broadcast live and in multiple languages on ICC.tv
data.text:
The up-and-coming stars of men's ODI cricket can be viewed live, on-demand and for FREE as the ICC Men's U19 Cricket World Cup is available on ICC.tv.

Five venues will host the action in the 15th edition of the ICC U19 Men’s Cricket World Cup 2024 with 41 matches to be played across 24 days in the competition.

Sixteen teams, divided into four groups, will play for the title that India currently holds after their triumph in 2022.

Live Streaming – Rest of the World

The matches will be available to view on ICC.tv in the following regions:

Afghanistan, Albania, Andorra, Armenia, Austria, Azerbaijan, Bangladesh, Belgium, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Brunei, Bulgaria, Cambodia, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Georgia, Germany, Greece, Holy See, Hong Kong, Hungary, Iceland, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Lao, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Macao, Macedonia, Malaysia, Malta, Moldova, Monaco, Mongolia, Montenegro, Myanmar, Nepal, Netherlands, Norway, Pakistan, Papua New Guinea, Philippines, Poland, Portugal, Kosovo, Romania, Russian Federation, San Marino, Singapore, Slovakia, Slovenia, Korea, Spain, Sri Lanka, Sweden, Switzerland, Taiwan, Tajikistan, Thailand, Timor-Leste, Turkey, Turkmenistan, Uzbekistan, Vietnam.

The matches will also be shown in New Zealand for any non-New Zealand pool and Super Six games.
